security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate DevOps/IaC engineering skill. The 618 static findings are overwhelmingly FALSE POSITIVES triggered by documentation patterns. Shell command examples in markdown (kubectl, terraform), security terminology (MD5, SHA1 in 'never use' contexts), and placeholder IPs in example configs were incorrectly flagged. The skill provides infrastructure templates, K8s manifest generation, and GitOps tooling - all standard DevOps workflows with no malicious intent.

content.user_title: Build cloud infrastructure with Terraform and Kubernetes
content.value_statement: DevOps teams struggle to manage complex cloud infrastructure across multiple environments. This skill provides ready-to-use Terraform templates, Kubernetes configurations, and CI/CD pipelines that follow industry best practices for security, scalability, and observability.
actual_capabilities: Generate production-ready Terraform configurations for multi-cloud infrastructure
Create Kubernetes deployments with health checks, autoscaling, and RBAC policies
Design CI/CD pipelines with GitOps workflows using ArgoCD or Flux
Implement observability stacks with Prometheus, Grafana, and structured logging
Apply security best practices including secrets management and least privilege
Generate infrastructure diagrams and documentation from code
limitations: Does not execute infrastructure changes directly - generates code for review
Does not access cloud provider APIs for real-time state assessment
Does not replace domain expertise for complex architecture decisions
Requires user to review and validate all generated configurations before deployment

use_cases.title: Create production Terraform modules
use_cases.description: Generate reusable Terraform modules for VPCs, databases, and Kubernetes clusters following security best practices.

use_cases.title: Set up GitOps deployment pipelines
use_cases.description: Configure ArgoCD or Flux with automated sync policies, health checks, and progressive delivery strategies.

use_cases.title: Implement observability and alerting
use_cases.description: Design monitoring dashboards, alerting rules, and runbooks for critical services with SLI/SLO definitions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Terraform setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a Terraform configuration for a production-ready AWS VPC with public and private subnets across three availability zones. Include security groups for an application load balancer and EKS cluster.

prompt_templates.title: K8s deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Kubernetes deployment manifest for a Python web application. Include readiness and liveness probes, resource limits, horizontal pod autoscaling, and configmap for configuration.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a GitHub Actions workflow that validates Terraform code with tfsec, scans Docker images for vulnerabilities, and deploys to Kubernetes using ArgoCD. Include approval gates for production.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-cloud security
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a security baseline for multi-cloud infrastructure. Include IAM policies with least privilege, secrets management using External Secrets Operator, and network policies that enforce zero-trust principles.

best_practices: Always use remote state with locking (S3 + DynamoDB for AWS) to prevent concurrent modifications and ensure state durability
Implement infrastructure immutability - replace resources rather than modify in-place to ensure reproducibility
Separate environments (dev/staging/prod) with distinct state files and restrict prod access to automated pipelines only
anti_patterns: Never hardcode credentials or secrets in Terraform files - use secret managers or environment variables
Avoid creating monolithic Terraform configurations - split by domain to enable independent deployments and faster iterations
Do not skip drift detection - regularly run terraform plan to identify differences between desired and actual state

faq.question: Does this skill deploy infrastructure to my cloud account?
faq.answer: No. This skill generates Terraform and Kubernetes code for you to review and deploy. You maintain full control over when and how infrastructure changes are applied.

faq.question: Which cloud providers are supported?
faq.answer: AWS, Azure, and GCP are fully supported. The skill includes provider-specific configurations, best practices, and optimization strategies for each platform.

faq.question: How does this skill handle secrets and credentials?
faq.answer: The skill follows security best practices by demonstrating external secrets management, IRSA patterns, and never hardcoding credentials. All generated configurations use secure secret injection methods.

faq.question: Can I use this for existing infrastructure?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can help you create Terraform configurations for existing resources using import commands, and generate policies for brownfield environments.

faq.question: Does this integrate with specific CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Jenkins, and ArgoCD workflows are all covered. Templates include validation, security scanning, and deployment stages.

faq.question: What Kubernetes versions are supported?
faq.answer: Kubernetes 1.26 through 1.30 are supported. The skill generates manifests compatible with modern API versions and includes schema validation.
